column2: 1. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:

column6: A road joins from the left
column10: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left

column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: they must turn either to the right or left.

column6: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column8: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 6. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: use your emergency or parking brake.
column10: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column10: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 10. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column6: when it first starts to rain.

column8: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 14. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 15. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column6: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column8: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column10: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.

column2: 19. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
20. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
22. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 23. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column10: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 24. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.
column6: slow down. If possible, change lanes.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column10: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.

column2: 25. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column6: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.
